response: "I can't keep up with everyone's expectations of perfection. It's suffocating."
"Why does society make me feel like I have to be flawless in every aspect of my life?"
"I feel like I'm losing touch with reality. It's like I'm living in a constant state of uncertainty."
"I'm so overwhelmed by the pressure to be perfect that I can't even recognize who I am anymore."
"Every mistake feels like a personal failure, fueling my fear of not measuring up."
"I wish I could escape this never-ending cycle of comparison and self-doubt."
"It's like there's a constant voice in my head telling me I'm not good enough, no matter what I do."
"I'm starting to question whether my worth as a person is solely defined by my external achievements."
"I'm losing sight of what truly matters because I'm too focused on trying to meet society's impossible standards."
"Sometimes, it feels like I'm going crazy, trying to live up to everyone's expectations of perfection."
